title: Packet loss at the start of games
body:
have this problem pretty much since i started playing, it would come and go.
I have a packet loss at the start of a game for about 3-5 mins, sometimes it gets to a point where i just teleport around, and its reallly hard to farm like this.

Please help me.

replies.body:
Look at all this great troubleshooting going on O_O! 

Generally, packet loss does happen between your network and our servers, and sometimes there's not a whole lot either of us can do if it's an issue with ISP routing or otherwise. Even still, let's be 100% sure of what exactly is going wrong by running a trace for me. 

Run a quick traceroute to the EUNE servers at 31.186.224.42 and paste the results so I can take a look. (PLEASE be sure to block out the first line which shows your IP!!!!)

It must be a connection issue, on your side i guess.
Are you using WiFi to connect ? if so change to ethernet, and check anything that could give you lag too, it might be related.
There are hundreds of possibilities for packet loss.

Im not sure it MUST be a problem with internet. I play on ethernet, 0% packet lost in other games or when i try to ping some websites, but in lol cant move like every 2-3 min for a while (everyone around move and i can see it)

Did you try to narrow down the issue ? like analyzing what packets goes through your network at that time ? (other computers/TV/any programs using internet/...)

I had a similar issue before and i fixed it by fixing other connection issues.
FIY you can use any computer with two ethernet ports as gateway for your all local network ( put it just behind your router ), that way you can see every single network packet going in/out of your LAN, might help narrowing the issue.

Do you know for sure that it's only related to LoL ? Did you tried to run a ping for example, you launch it in a console in the background, for like 400/500 pings while you are experiencing this issue, to see if you loose packets here too, you can try a bunch of other ways too.

If everyone else move around and you can see it, maybe your firewall blocks some packets, maybe your router firewall does so ( maybe it let through incoming packets but don't send those who are supposed to be sent to LoL, might explain why you see them moving while you can't move ).
Firewall is OFF + i said already about pings, 0% lost packets even after 1000+.

Wanted to check in on your troubleshooting as well even though you're not the OP. Have you been pinging *our* servers or just your ISP? Be sure to ping League's servers to see what your connection to League looks like specifically (EUW servers: 185.40.65.1).
I pinged random sites like google, youtube. I wanted to ping lol servers but i did not know them ip. Are you sure 185.40.65.1 isnt wrong ip? I have 100% lost here which is impossible

That was actually the IP for EUW not EUNE (my bad, got them saved on a notepad side-by-side whoops) but regardless they would still return similar results. That 100% packet loss basically just tells me that your network works a little differently when it does a ping test, which I'd need a little more info to go off of in this case. 

Tell ya what, I don't want to keep going back and forth over hours time so go ahead and send this trace route data and some network logs over to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They can look through those much deeper than I can here and should be able to get to the bottom of this with ya!
